result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian M Staehler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to Court costs ($343) and DNA surcharge ($200).  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No VIOLENT contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint or any other family members.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian M Staehler

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Brian M Staehler in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein. 
Jury Trial Canceled.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Repeater enhancer is struck.
Count 1 is Dismissed as a Read-In.
Victim presented statements to the court.

Court orders the following:
Count 2:
SENTENCE WITHHELD;
11 Days Credit - If revoked.

TERM OF PROBATION: 12 Months;
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No VIOLENT contact with:  the victim listed in the criminal complaint or any other family members
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

FINE or COURT COSTS:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  $200
D.V. Surcharge:  $100
Bail to be applied
Balance to be paid as a condition of probation
treatment letter filed.
Sentencing recommendation dated September 8, 2014 filed by Attorney Rothstein.
filed by the State.
